ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained the ability to specify my arguments to a case study and to organize my arguments to maximize understandability and effectiveness.
I have improved my critical thinking and conceptualization skills in terms of essay writing

Through this course, I learned how to concisely write in shorter amounts of time, how to use collaboration to foster essay ideas and individual analyses, and how to apply philosophical concepts to a scientific real-life setting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths were that the course was structured to keep students as engaged as possible throughout the semester.
I feel like there could be more writers feedback since I never knew how my writing would fare against the rubric. I felt like the readings complimented my understanding of the course material well.

Strength - The main paper was due before the finals period

Weakness - The concepts and readings were too theoretical
My weakness was writing and my weakness is still writing

The strengths of this course is definitely the collaborative spirit and opportunity for one-on-one feedback that helps students grow as writers and thinkers. However, a weakness is that the timeline of having essay after essay can grow to overwhelm students and stunt growth and reflection on the mistakes made in previous essays. Thus, I think having assignments that help do-over problem areas in essays previously turned in or help actively develop solutions to problems pointed out would help a lot.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yeah! If you're interested in epistemology, this course could be a great intro to it, and also a nice experience to academic writing in college.

I might not recommend this course to anyone who cares about maintaining a good grade in this class since that was quite difficult. However, if someone wants to get better at writing, Id recommend this course to them.

No

I honestly did not enjoy this class. I don't really know if I was the problem, but the mood of the class was always low. People weren't really excited to engage in class conversations,
No, the teacher graded very harshly and mentioned at the start of the course that he thinks grades shouldnt matter.
Yes, this course is integral to growing as a writer and developing a more professional style of writing.
